0.title: Punjab CM Channi, Sidhu Moose Wala booked for violating poll code
0.article_body: Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi and Congress candidate Sidhu Moose Wala were booked for violating the model code of conduct. This comes following a complaint by Aam Aadmi Party alleging that Channi and Sidhu held a door-to-door campaign in Mansa beyond the 6 pm deadline on Friday. A case under Section 188 of IPC was filed against Channi and Sidhu.

1.title: Man finds chicken foot in takeaway meal in UK; shares pic
1.article_body: A man has said he was left feeling "physically sick" after finding a deep-fried chicken foot in his takeaway meal. The man who ordered a salt and pepper chicken dish shared a picture of the chicken foot. The customer said he contacted the takeaway and claims they hung up the phone on him after he complained.

2.title: Kejriwal inaugurates 12,430 new smart classrooms in 240 Delhi govt schools
2.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday inaugurated 12,430 new smart classrooms in 240 government schools in the city. Delhi Deputy CM and Education Minister Manish Sisodia, and Delhi Home Minister Satyendar Jain were also present at the event held at a school in Rajokri. "These world-class classrooms have...modern techno-features...[are] disabled-friendly," Delhi's Directorate of Education said.

3.title: Conditions are ideal for more dangerous COVID-19 variants to emerge: WHO
3.article_body: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has said conditions are ideal for "more transmissible, more dangerous COVID-19 variants to emerge". "But we can end the pandemic as a global health emergency this year," he added. The lower severity of the Omicron variant combined with high vaccine coverage in some countries is "driving a dangerous narrative that COVID-19 is over", he warned.

4.title: Zuckerberg's sister Randi releases crypto-themed version of Adele's 'Hello'
4.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's sister Randi Zuckerberg has released a parody video of Adele's song 'Hello', featuring lyrics about cryptocurrencies and decentralised finance (DeFi). "Community should be fun, crypto should be welcoming not intimidating," she tweeted. Randi is the Founder of Hug, a platform that supports Web3 creators, and a member of crypto exchange Okcoin's advisory council.

5.title: Congress leader uses donkey to protest against T'gana CM; arrested for stealing it
5.article_body: Telangana Congress leader Venkat Balmoor was arrested on charges of stealing a donkey after he led a protest with the donkey on Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao's birthday. He and others had placed up a picture of the CM on the donkey. They were protesting against the CM for "making false promises of jobs and not issuing government employment notifications".

6.title: PM pushes for early completion of 508-km Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project
6.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has pushed for the early completion of the 508-kilometre-long Mumbai-Ahmedabad high-speed rail project. The PM said his government's focus is on creating infrastructure for the 21st century in the financial capital. The bullet train project is need of the hour to strengthen the infrastructure capacity building and reinforce Mumbai's identity as the "city of dreams", he added.

7.title: Student told to remove 'tilak' from forehead to enter Karnataka college
7.article_body: Amid the ongoing hijab row, a student was stopped from entering the premises of a college in the Indi town of Karnataka's Vijayapura district for sporting a 'tilak' (vermilion) on his forehead, as per reports. The college authorities reportedly stopped the student at the gate and asked him to remove the 'tilak' from his forehead before entering the college.

8.title: Full military mobilisation ordered by Russian-backed separatist leaders in Ukraine
8.article_body: Russian-backed separatist leaders in Ukraine ordered a full military mobilisation on Saturday. Separatist authorities had on Friday announced plans to evacuate around 700,000 people, citing fears of an imminent attack by Ukrainian forces. Meanwhile, the Ukrainian military today said it had recorded 12 ceasefire violations by pro-Russian separatists in eastern Ukraine.

9.title: Reality hit me hard when I saw Bappi da's body, I broke down: Shaan
9.article_body: Singer Shaan has said he was shattered when he saw late musician Bappi Lahiri for the last time. "The reality hit me when I...saw his body...It really caught me and I broke down," he added. "His daughter (Rema) was inconsolable...She kept saying to Bappi da, 'Look, Shaan is here...say hi to him.' It was an emotionally heavy moment," said Shaan.

10.title: Aishwarya in talks to star opposite Rajinikanth in Nelson's next: Report
10.article_body: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan is reportedly in talks to join Rajinikanth in Nelson Dilipkumar's next film, tentatively titled 'Thalaivar 169'. The actors previously worked together in 2010 film 'Enthiran' aka 'Robot', which was directed by Shankar. The upcoming project will reportedly go on the floors this year. "It's a typical Nelson Dilipkumar film that's high on content," a source told Pinkvilla.

11.title: Delhi University starts COVID vaccination drive for students & staff
11.article_body: Delhi University has begun its COVID-19 vaccination drive for students, teaching and non-teaching staff at WUS Health Centre at North Campus and in West Delhi, an official said. While the vaccination centre in West Delhi will run from Monday to Saturday, candidates can get vaccinated in the North campus on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday from 10 am to 4 pm.

12.title: Pune district records below 1,000 daily COVID-19 cases for 7 days
12.article_body: Pune district has recorded less than 1,000 daily coronavirus cases for seven days in a row with 576 new cases on Friday, according to official data. The district also reported three deaths the same day and currently has 6,032 active cases. The Pune Municipal Corporation recorded the highest new cases at 322, taking its progressive count to 6,76,639.

13.title: US Surgeon General Vivek Murthy, family test positive for COVID-19
13.article_body: US Surgeon General Vivek Murthy announced that he and his family have tested positive for COVID-19 despite best efforts to stay safe. The Indian-American physician said he, his wife, and his five-year-old son have mild symptoms. Murthy added that his four-year-old daughter, who'd tested positive first over the past weekend, was "doing ok" and her fever was starting to improve.

14.title: Dhoni is the best captain of all time, Yuvraj is my idol: Tewatia
14.article_body: Responding to a query about the cricketer he considers the "best captain" of all time, all-rounder Rahul Tewatia named MS Dhoni adding that Yuvraj Singh is his "idol". Tewatia was bought by franchise Gujarat Titans for ₹9 crore in the IPL mega auction and termed Rashid Khan as the player who could be the team's MVP in IPL 2022.

15.title: Great character on display: Virat Kohli on India winning 2nd T20I vs WI
15.article_body: Reacting to India's triumph by eight runs in the second T20I against West Indies to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series, Virat Kohli said there was "great character" on display. "Went down to the wire," added Kohli on the match which saw West Indies compete till the last over having been handed a target of 187 runs.

16.title: UPSC increases civil services vacancies; cross 1000-mark after 6 years
16.article_body: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has modified the number of civil services vacancies for this year, increasing the number from 861 to 1,011. It's after six years that UPSC has crossed the 1,000-mark in its vacancies. The increase comes after the government decided to recruit 150 personnel in IRMS Group 'A' through the Civil Services Examination 2022.

17.title: Six-lane Bahadurpura Flyover to be ready by March 31: GHMC
17.article_body: The Bahadurpura Flyover will be available for commuters by March 31, 2022, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation informed while sharing pictures on Twitter. The six-lane bi-directional flyover, part of the Strategic Road Development Program (SRDP), is being built at an estimated cost of ₹69 crore. It will reduce pollution and benefit people visiting the Nehru Zoological park, the GHMC added.

18.title: 100 modified bike silencers seized in Mumbai for noise pollution
18.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police seized about 100 bikes using modified silencers which were creating loud noise on the roads. ''Most of the bikes seized were of Royal Enfield or Pulsar. These bikes were returned only after the bike owners brought the original silencer and installed it,'' DCP Traffic said. We crushed the modified silencers using a bulldozer, he added.
